unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: telecommunications: fiber to home expansion gains momentum in india

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26 – Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) announced today a significant acceleration in its Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) rollout across tier-II and tier-III cities in India. The state-owned telecom provider aims to connect an additional 50,000 homes by the end of Q1 2024, focusing on areas with limited high-speed internet access.
normalised: new delhi, october twenty six – Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (B S N L) announced today a significant acceleration in its Fiber to Home (F T T H) rollout across tier two and tier three cities in India. the state owned telecom provider aims to connect an additional fifty thousand homes by the end of Q one two thousand and twenty four, focusing on areas with limited high speed internet access.

unnormalised: Dr. Rajesh Kumar, Chairman of BSNL, stated the initiative is crucial for bridging the digital divide and enabling services like e-education and telemedicine. The expansion will utilize indigenous technology and infrastructure, boosting the 'Make in India' campaign.
normalised: Doctor Rajesh Kumar, Chairman of B S N L, stated the initiative is crucial for bridging the digital divide and enabling services like e-education and telemedicine. the expansion will utilize indigenous technology and infrastructure, boosting the 'Make in India' campaign.

unnormalised: Reliance Jio continues its aggressive FTTH expansion, targeting a presence in every district of Uttar Pradesh. The company reported connecting over 1 million homes in the last quarter alone. Airtel is also actively competing, offering bundled plans including OTT subscriptions to attract customers.
normalised: Reliance Jio continues its aggressive F T T H expansion, targeting a presence in every district of Pradesh. the company reported connecting over one million homes in the last quarter alone. Airtel is also actively competing, offering bundled plans including O T T subscriptions to attract customers.

unnormalised: Analysts estimate the Indian FTTH market to reach Rs. 20,000 crore by 2025. Challenges remain, including right-of-way approvals and the laying of fiber optic cables across densely populated urban areas and remote villages covering over 1000 km. Several players propose aerial deployment.
normalised: analysts estimate the Indian F T T H market to reach rupee twenty thousand crore by two thousand and twenty five. challenges remain, including right of way approvals and the laying of fiber optic cables across densely populated urban areas and remote villages covering over one thousand kilometer. several players propose aerial deployment.

unnormalised: The new fiber networks provide download speeds of up to 300 Mbps, facilitating seamless streaming and enabling smart home solutions in homes ranging from 500 sq ft apartments to larger bungalows.
normalised: the new fiber networks provide download speeds of up to three hundred M B P S, facilitating seamless streaming and enabling smart home solutions in homes ranging from five hundred square feet apartments to larger bungalows.
